;The global obesity and overweight problems have become increasingly apparent in recent decades. According to data from the World Health Organization, in 2016 Nearly 40% of adults worldwide are overweight, of which 13% are obese. There are approximately 2 billion overweight people. This increase continues despite public health measures to prevent and slow obesity in many countries. Along with the obesity epidemic comes a large disease burden. How to better manage weight has become an urgent problem in the field of health sciences.

;

;;Balancing the quality and quantity of carbohydrates;

;

;Carbohydrates, as a major source of dietary energy for people, have long been the focus of weight loss. Coping strategies such as the "ketogenic diet" of eating less or no staple food, or even strictly limiting carbohydrate intake have been derived. The "ketogenic diet" cuts off carbohydrates as an energy source and attempts to promote weight loss by burning fat to provide energy. Although this method has some short-term experimental support, what will happen if it is persisted in the long term is still a mystery.

;

;Moreover, the "ketogenic diet" requires maintaining a high level of fat intake while maximizing carbohydrate intake, which may increase the risk related to cardiovascular disease. In addition, it will also put pressure on the liver, kidneys and maintenance of nutritional balance, and there is a risk of a series of adverse reactions such as cognitive decline, constipation, fatigue, and nausea. Therefore, long-term adherence to such a diet for weight loss remains controversial.

;

;However, compared with the controversial "ketogenic diet" that strictly limits carbohydrate intake, a diet that reasonably controls carbohydrates has actually been widely recognized, including paying more attention to nutritional balance and simplicity. Processed “Mediterranean Diet” etc. Recently, scientists from Harvard School of Public Health and other institutions also found through long-term observational studies that instead of focusing generally on the total amount of carbohydrate intake, it is better to pay more attention to the quality and source of carbohydrates, so as to achieve better long-term weight management.

;

;Because their research data shows that some carbohydrate-containing foods do make you fatter as you eat them, but there are also some carbohydrate-rich foods that may actually have a weight loss effect if you eat too much of them. Overall, higher glycemic index and glycemic load will lead to weight gain. Adding 100 grams of starch or added sugar per day increased weight gain by 1.5 kilograms and 0.9 kilograms respectively over four years. Relevant research was published in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) in September 2023. The main sources of daily starch are seeds and tubers such as wheat and rice, which are various staple foods.

;

;Starchy vegetables such as potatoes and peas, and refined grains are also associated with weight gain. A 100-gram daily intake increase will increase weight gain by 2.6 kilograms and 0.8 kilograms respectively. But if it is non-starchy vegetables and whole grains, the increase in intake will actually reduce weight gain and help control weight. Increasing the intake of non-starchy vegetables by 100 grams per day will reduce weight gain by 3 kilograms, and the intake of 100 grams of whole grains will reduce weight gain by 0.4 kilograms. Similarly, consuming carbohydrates through fruits can also help reduce weight gain, with a daily intake increase of 100 grams corresponding to 1.6 kilograms less weight gain.

;

;The reason why these data are limited to four years to assess weight change is because some health data in the study are updated on a four-year cycle. Using data from more than 130,000 people in projects such as the Nurses' Health Study, researchers analyzed the relationship between people's diet and weight changes over more than two decades and discovered these overall patterns of carbohydrates. Over the past two decades, people's average weight has increased by 8.8 kilograms, about 1.5 kilograms every four years.

;

;;Highly processed carbohydrates have become a target;

;

;If a person pays more attention to the management of carbohydrate quality and sources, use equal amounts of non-starchy vegetables, fruits and Substituting whole grains for foods like refined grains, starchy vegetables, and sugary drinks will result in less weight gain. In addition to foods such as vegetables and whole grains that are consumed in large amounts, an increase in dietary fiber intake also helps with weight management. Every 10 grams of increase per day corresponds to a reduction of 0.8 kilograms of weight gain. Considering that the age of the people in the study happens to span the middle-aged and elderly stages, including the critical period of weight gain in middle age, this large-sample long-term follow-up study has important reference significance for middle-aged people to strengthen weight management.

;

;Of course, although the latest research data has the advantages of large volume and long follow-up time, and can capture more changes in diet and health, there are still some limitations, such as carbohydrate intake and Information such as weight is reported by the respondents themselves. There may be certain errors in these data, which will affect relevant conclusions and interpretations. To better understand the long-term health effects of carbohydrates, more randomized, controlled, long-term studies are needed to further confirm the conclusions in the latest findings.

;

;As for why people become obese, the most popular explanation is energy imbalance, which is commonly known as "eating more and moving less", but this is not the exact answer to the common obesity phenomenon in humans. As obesity rates remain high, some scientists think the problem may not be that simple. Two common explanations currently take into account more complex body system factors. For example, one view is that on the basis that energy intake exceeds consumption, because modern people eat too much ultra-processed food with high energy density, there may also be endocrine, metabolic and nervous system effects, making it more difficult for people to eat food. Self-control.

;

;Another explanation related to insulin is that the hormonal response triggered by a large amount of ultra-processed carbohydrates causes the body to store more energy in fat, resulting in a lack of energy required for basic metabolism of the body. , after the brain recognizes this state, it will issue a hunger command, thus entering a vicious cycle of getting fatter and overeating. While the understanding of obesity remains controversial, these analyzes and a host of health studies have focused on carbohydrates in processed foods, including all types of so-called "junk food" that are high in sugar and fat.

;

;Ultra-processed carbohydrates are classified as "junk food", which is not unrelated to the current scientific community's understanding of the functions of carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are the only macronutrient for which there is no minimum intake requirement. In reality, in some places people eat a lot, but in other places people eat very little. What specific ranges of carbohydrate intake humans need to maintain in order to survive, be healthy, and even live longer are specific questions that need to be answered by scientific evidence.

;

;;The risks and costs of eating out;

;

;From an evolutionary perspective, larger brain capacity is consistent with the evolutionary process of humans, and larger brain capacity is consistent with the evolutionary process of humans. The brain needs more energy support. After humans entered agricultural civilization, typical lifestyle changes included growing and eating grains, which are foods rich in carbohydrates. For this reason, the human digestive system has become more adapted to starch, but accordingly, new eating habits have also brought about a series of new health problems.

;

;Latest research suggests that the mechanisms by which carbohydrates, glycemic index, and glycemic load may have negative health effects on weight may include enhanced responses to changes in insulin and other hormones that favor fat accumulation. . In recent years, some studies have shown that in addition to weight gain, the quality of carbohydrates may also increase a series of other health risks.

;

;In 2019, a systematic analysis study published in The Lancet showed that compared with those who ate the least dietary fiber, people who ate the most dietary fiber had better health outcomes. The risks of a range of diseases are 15% to 30% lower, including lower cardiovascular disease mortality, coronary heart disease incidence, stroke incidence and mortality, and lower risks of type 2 diabetes and colorectal cancer. In addition, clinical trial data also shows that eating more dietary fiber will lower blood pressure and total cholesterol. The lowest risk dietary fiber intake is 25 to 29 grams per day.

;

;Similarly, studies have found that whole grain intake may also help reduce overall disease risk. Increasing the intake of dietary fiber in the daily diet, replacing refined grains with whole grains, and eating more coarse grains will not only help with weight management, but also improve people's health.

;

;It is worth noting that with the epidemic of obesity in recent years, scientists have tried to verify a variety of weight loss and weight management strategies, most of which are related to "eating", including the total energy of meals and the amount of food consumed. time. In 2022, a one-year intermittent fasting trial carried out in China found that while restricting food energy, arranging eating times from 8 am to 4 pm every day and not eating at other times, such a The weight loss effect of this dietary pattern is no better than that of energy restriction alone, indicating the importance of controlling energy intake for weight loss.

;

;However, in April 2023, Australian researchers further narrowed the eating time window to 8 am to 12 noon every day, limiting the intake of 30% of the required energy to only these four hours. And you stick to this eating method for three non-consecutive days in a week, and you can eat whatever you want at other times. The experimental results found that under certain circumstances, intermittent fasting that limits meal times still has its own unique effect, not only can Lowering the weight of trial participants could also improve people's glucose tolerance and reduce their risk of type 2 diabetes.

;

;Leonie Heilbronn, a professor at the University of Adelaide School of Medicine and others who have long studied fasting and meal times, explained to Southern Weekend reporters that human metabolism is governed by biological rhythms The brain operates downwards, alternating between day and night 24 hours a day. Improper eating time will cause the brain's light and dark rhythms to be out of sync with the biological clocks in other organs and tissues. Moving meals earlier and avoiding eating at night will help the body coordinate these rhythms. combine.

;

;In 2022, a randomized controlled trial in the UK also supported the conclusion of eating early, but it was not because of differences in metabolism at different times, but because the study at that time found that if you eat more in the morning, your overall health will be reduced throughout the day. If the meal time is moved forward, people will not feel too hungry that day, and appetite and total energy intake will be controlled.

;

;;Weight management should be a long-term plan;

;

;For weight control, no matter what the strategy is or how difficult it is, whether it can be persisted in the long term is the key to weight management. key. Otherwise, no matter how radical and rapid the weight loss method is, it will rebound when you can't persist, and destroy people's confidence in weight management during the continuous rebound. Some people whose obesity problem is particularly serious and whose weight loss through conventional methods has been ineffective can only reduce their health risks through extremely limited methods such as bariatric surgery. However, this method requires the removal of part of the stomach, which is extremely invasive and does not work. Not suitable for most people who have less severe weight problems.

;

;From this perspective, the latest research controls weight by managing the source of carbohydrates, which does not involve harsh food intake restrictions or long fasting times, and has positive implications for people's long-term weight management. significance.

;

;Moreover, the researchers also found that the relationship between carbohydrate sources and weight management was more obvious in overweight or obese people than in people of normal weight, indicating that these people may be more susceptible to weight changes. Sensitive, more fragile, but in turn suggests that those who pay more attention to the sources of carbohydrates in their diet may benefit more from this type of weight management.

;

;Reflected in specific foods, it is necessary to limit sugary drinks and various types of steamed, fried, and baked refined rice noodles, and instead eat more roughly processed grains, fruits, and non-starchy foods. Vegetables etc. The "Mediterranean diet" widely praised by scientists is actually more scientific in managing carbohydrate sources and maintaining nutritional balance. In addition to consuming more vegetables, fruits, and whole grains, it also eats more beans and nuts, and more Fish and moderate amounts of poultry and dairy, but not a lot of red meat.

;Recently, a screenshot of a research report comparing BYD’s U8 and T-90 main battle tanks was exposed. This screenshot of the research report comes from the special research report on BYD released by the Western Securities R&D Center on October 24, 2023: "BYD (002594.SZ) first coverage report: Cost is the shield, technology is the spear, and the sword points at the global automotive leader" .

;

;On page 26 of the research report, in order to present the output power of BYD's Yi Sifang four-wheel motor, Western Securities compared the output power, engine, and body of BYD's U8 and T-90 main battle tanks. , amphibious, on-site U-turn, lateral travel, zero-hundred acceleration and the number of driving wheels, and concluded: "The technical indicators of Yi Sifang's four-wheel motor are comprehensively leading the industry." Looking up at the amphibious and lateral travel functions of U8, T -90 tanks are "none".

;

;According to Blue Whale Finance, a relevant person from Western Securities responded that the report was not written by an intern, and that the comparison of BYD’s U8 with main battle tanks was affected by relevant publicity.

;

;What is the impact of relevant publicity? Previously, many self-media compared BYD’s U8 with tanks. Regardless of whether the research report of Western Securities was influenced by self-media, but comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, and then claiming that its technical indicators are comprehensively leading the industry, whether the relevant arguments and conclusions are rigorous and reasonable will naturally be questioned by investors and public opinion. .

;

;In addition, in June this year, Western Securities and analysts were punished for research reports. According to the warning letter from the Shaanxi Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission: After investigation, the internal control mechanism for the securities research report publishing business of Western Securities is not sound, individual surveys did not fulfill the pre-approval procedures, sales staff participated in the assessment of research report analysts, and compliance management did not cover expert consulting services. The main business links; the quality control and review of research reports are not strict, and some research reports have unreasonable valuation forecasts and imprudent conclusions.

;

;The relevant securities research report produced by Luo Yamein, the signed analyst of BYD’s research report, has problems such as imprudent research methods, lack of reasonable justification for some assumptions, and insufficient basis for some conclusions. Not only was it shown The warning letter is also recorded in the securities and futures market integrity files.

;

;Less than half a year later, Western Securities and the same analyst released another controversial research report.

;

;Of course, this was not done by a securities firm called Western Securities. In recent years, there have been numerous cases of securities companies being fined for "weird research reports". On December 30, 2021, the Jiangxi Securities Regulatory Bureau issued two law enforcement documents, punishing Guosheng Securities and its researchers for their conduct related to the research report "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing". On October 18 of that year, a report titled "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing" by Guosheng Securities attracted public attention. In the report, it is explained in detail how the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" dominate the market's time cycle, and how to apply the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" in timing. Liu Fubing, who issued this research report, has been in the industry for more than 12 years and has been listed as the best analyst of New Fortune 8 times, including No. 1 6 times.

;

;If we say that the above-mentioned research report is "even if it is not shocking, it will never stop", so it has become a talking point for people. There is also a type of "weird research reports" that are more likely to mislead investors.

;

;In July 2020, the Jiangsu Securities Regulatory Bureau posted an administrative penalty decision against two analysts Ma Haobo who signed the research report "Fucheng In-depth Report 2: Three 10 billion to support doubling of market value" , Tang Weiliang were fined a total of 200,000 yuan.

;

;In 2016, a research report released by Soochow Securities boldly predicted that Fucheng Shares (600965.SH), "the number one A-share funeral stock", would be the absolute leader in the funeral industry in the future. And gave Fucheng shares a "buy" rating.

;

;However, on October 25 of that year, Fucheng Shares issued a "clarification announcement" to clarify the relevant contents of the research report. Soochow Securities' "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the number of tombs after the completion of the third phase of Fucheng's pagoda cemetery will reach 400,000. Based on this data, it was concluded that Fucheng's net profit would be 15.5 billion yuan. After investigation, Fucheng Co., Ltd.'s pagoda cemetery plans to build about 125,000 tombs. "Fucheng Research Report" also stated that the industrial merger and acquisition fund jointly established by Fucheng Co., Ltd. and an investment company has a total scale of 10 billion yuan. The current scale is 1 billion yuan, and the follow-up fund scale will be 9 billion yuan. After investigation, as of October 2016, the size of the above-mentioned M&A fund was only 1 billion yuan. The status of subsequent funds will need to be made by Fucheng Shares based on the progress of the first-phase fund and the quality of the assets acquired. Third, "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the company's major shareholders have 10 billion in cash and have sufficient funds to serve as the backend of the above-mentioned merger and acquisition funds. After investigation, as of October 2016, the major shareholders had not made a decision in this regard.

;

;The relevant quoted data in the research report released by Soochow Securities is far from the actual data of Fucheng Shares. I am afraid that the source of the information and whether the data has been investigated and verified are all a mess. How can a research report like this deserve market credibility?

;

;The so-called research reports are analysis reports prepared by financial institutions such as securities companies, fund companies, banks, etc. They mainly include company analysis reports, industry analysis reports, investment strategy reports, etc. The purpose of the research report is to help investors better understand the market, the company, and the industry so that they can be used as a reference when investing. However, the content is full of errors and omissions, pointing the research direction towards Feng Shui, or making gimmicks of comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, which reflects that some brokers do not pay attention to the professionalism of the research report, and even use the research report as a tool for speculation.

;

;The motivation behind securities firms’ “weird research reports” cannot simply be attributed to sensationalism. In financial markets, information release is a form of power to some extent. Therefore, regulatory authorities have corresponding standards for financial institutions, listed companies, and media to release various types of investment-oriented information. As professional information providers, brokerage research reports influence investors' decisions to a considerable extent. However, in the process of pursuing so-called market influence, some securities companies make some shocking remarks to attract attention and attention. There will be traffic or profit considerations, and they may even interfere or distort market trends. Since brokerages are also one of the important stock holders in the stock market, if a brokerage publishes a research report that is "bullish" or "short" on a listed company or a certain sector in an exaggerated way, and secretly buys or sells the corresponding stocks, wouldn't it be typical? Manipulation of the stock market?

;

;In this regard, regulatory authorities have also promulgated relevant new management policies many times in recent years. In May last year, the regulatory authorities sent the "Notice on the "Double Random" On-site Inspection of the Securities Research Report Business to all securities firms. The report shows that in 2022, a special "double random" on-site inspection of research and reporting business will be carried out in the entire industry, covering a total of 45 securities companies and 300 research reports. In September of that year, the China Securities Association reiterated the self-regulatory management of the securities research business of securities firms, including that holdings of more than 1% of the research target stocks must be disclosed and that reverse operations are not allowed within two trading days of the release of the research report; however, various management measures do not seem to hinder The continuation of "Weird Research Reports".

;

;This shows that for strange research reports, the regulatory authorities’ punishment and supervision need to be strengthened. Warning letters, inclusion in integrity files, etc. cannot touch the core interests of relevant personnel and securities companies, so that they would rather have short-term market effects than adhere to compliance. Only by clarifying the responsibilities of securities firms in the production and release of research reports and continuing to increase penalties for violations can the regulatory authorities stop the vicious cycle of "bad coins eliminating good coins" in securities firms' research reports.

;

;This round of transfers in Hengyang is considered the "first sale" of government data and has attracted widespread attention. Visual China/Picture

;

;On November 15, 2023, the Hengyang Municipal Public Resources Trading Center issued a notice stating that according to the request from the transferor Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau, the "Hengyang Municipal Government Data Resources and Intelligence" is now suspended. "Urban franchise rights transfer project" transaction activities.

;

;Five days ago, the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center announced that it would sell Hengyang municipal government data resources and smart city franchise rights through online bidding, with a starting price of 1.8 billion yuan.

;

;Nowhere has previously auctioned and transferred government data resources in the form of a franchise. Therefore, this round of transfer is considered the "first auction" of government data and has attracted widespread attention.

;

;“After receiving a letter from the Hengyang Administrative Approval Service Bureau, the transaction was suspended, but the letter did not explain the specific reasons.” A staff member of the Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center told Southern Weekend reporters that there had been The company called to inquire about the project.

;

;Two staff members of the Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that the above-mentioned franchise transfer project was suspended because they received notification from the superior department.

;

; "The state is coordinating this (public data) work, and they will give some guidance before proceeding." A staff member of the Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau told Southern Weekend reporters that the project is on hold. , the plan still needs to be improved.

;

;Does not involve national security, business secrets or personal privacy

;

;According to the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center, the transfer was approved by the Hengyang Municipal Government, and the subject matter is divided into two parts: government affairs data resources and smart cities.

;

;In December 2021, Hengyang, Hunan Province issued the "Hengyang Municipal Government Data Sharing and Open Management Measures" (hereinafter referred to as the Management Measures).

;

;The management measures clearly state that government data refers to various types of information such as documents, materials, charts, pictures, videos and data produced or obtained by government departments in the course of performing their duties and recorded and saved in a certain form. Resources include information resources collected by various government departments directly or through third parties in accordance with the law, authorized and managed in accordance with the law, and information resources formed by relying on the government information system to perform their duties.

;

;"Encourage the open utilization of information under the conditions of ensuring data security, personal privacy and corporate commercial confidentiality." The management measures state that it is necessary to promote the registration and confirmation of open data, value assessment and other work, and actively explore the data market operations.

;

;The management measures state that public data that involves national security, business secrets and personal privacy, or that is not allowed to be opened in accordance with laws, regulations and other regulations, are parts that are not allowed to be opened. Any leakage of state secrets, work secrets, business secrets and personal privacy will be dealt with in accordance with the National Secrets Law and relevant regulations.

;

;In June 2023, Guizhou issued a document requiring that big data authorities at all levels authorize qualified market entities to operate government data at the same level and develop data that does not involve state secrets, commercial secrets, or personal privacy. Data services and products and trade through Guiyang Big Data Exchange.

;

;The above-mentioned management measures of Hengyang state that the data rights belong to the government, and Hengyang Development Investment Group Co., Ltd. is authorized to develop and operate it through a franchise. According to the Enterprise Alert, the company is the largest urban investment platform in Hengyang, with assets exceeding 140 billion yuan, and is 100% owned by the Hengyang Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission.

;

;However, the Hengyang Municipal Party Committee and Municipal Government believe that the government data operation effect of Hengyang Development Investment Group needs to be improved.

;

;On July 27, 2023, the official website of the Hengyang Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision released the "Notice on the Progress of Inspection and Rectification by the Committee of the Communist Party of China Hengyang Development Investment Group Co., Ltd."

;

;The second issue reported is "Ineffective implementation of the decisions and arrangements of the municipal party committee and municipal government." In this regard, the rectification situation reads, "Accelerate the injection of some asset resources that have been expressly determined by the municipal party committee and government... Actively strive to complete the joint review of the implementation plan of government data resources (including Hengyang Mass App) and smart city franchise rights.";

;What content is involved in smart cities is not mentioned on the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center and the transaction attachments.

;

;The pricing method for public data is not yet clear

;

;On the official website of Hengyang Public Resource Trading Center, the transfer of government data resources will adopt a bidding method, with a starting price of 1.8 billion yuan, each time The price increase is 10 million yuan. It is disclosed in the transaction attachment that the starting price is the appraisal price of the target, but the columns for the appraisal agency and the appraisal base date are both blank.

;

;Why did the project evaluation price reach 1.8 billion yuan? Staff from the Hengyang Administrative Approval Service Bureau did not respond.

;

;Currently, the pricing of data resources is an industry problem. In February 2023, Zhao Jingwu, associate professor at Beihang University School of Law, wrote an article stating that data valuation indicators are not unified and data quality standards are difficult to determine.

;

;He believes that even in general data trading activities, the so-called market pricing is just the result of self-negotiation between the parties to the transaction. This "one thing, one discussion" data valuation model is difficult to achieve for digital purposes. The market provides sufficient reference basis.

;

;Government data faces the same problem. On November 16, at the main forum of the 2023 China Data Element Industry Innovation Conference, Wang Jiandong, deputy director of the Price Monitoring Center of the National Development and Reform Commission, said, “Before the end of this year or early next year, management measures for government-guided pricing of public data may be introduced. ”

;

;The official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center shows that the return mechanism of the government data resource franchise project is “user pays”. During the franchise period, the franchisee can charge fees from users within the scope of the franchise in return for project construction. However, the official website did not announce the specific number of years.

;

;One interviewee’s company is responsible for building a government data platform for a southern province. He explained to Southern Weekend reporters that users who will pay mainly refer to enterprises in various places that have information business needs, rather than individuals.

;

;Prior to this, Hangzhou, Qingdao and other places have also tried to authorize operations for public data.

;

;In September 2023, Hangzhou released the "Public Data Authorized Operation Implementation Plan (Trial)". The document states that the next step is to determine the operating entity of the authorized operation platform, and with the consent of the municipal government, will be specifically responsible for the construction and operation, data management, operation and maintenance, and security of the authorized operation platform.

;

;Hangzhou’s plan states that priority will be given to supporting the development of public data authorization operations in the fields of credit, transportation, medical care, health, employment, social security, education, technology, finance, enterprise registration and supervision, housing construction, provident funds, and public security. , led by the competent departments in the field. Public data that is prohibited from being opened shall not be authorized for operation.

;

;Enrolled into university at the age of 26 and graduated with a doctorate at the age of 38. This year, Bian Jianlin turns 70.

;

;At two o'clock in the afternoon on October 18, 2023, Bian Jianlin appeared at the door of the office of China University of Political Science and Law on time. He was tall and thin, wearing a fitted black casual suit and a trousers. He was wearing trousers and holding a red paper bag in his hand, which contained three volumes of "Governing the Country by Law and Criminal Procedure - Collected Works of Bian Jianlin's Legal Studies". For his 70th birthday this month, the publisher specially planned this collection of essays.

;

;In 1979, eight years after graduating from high school, Bian Jianlin left his hometown in Jiangsu and entered Beijing Political Science and Law School, which had just resumed school after the Cultural Revolution. College, which is now China University of Political Science and Law. Relying on employee scholarships provided by the state, Bian Jianlin completed his bachelor's and master's degrees. Just before life was about to reach another fork in the road, "a major event happened." In 1986, the third batch of law doctoral programs in the country was confirmed, and two law professors from China University of Political Science and Law were appointed as doctoral supervisors.

;

;In 1987, Bian Jianlin studied under Professor Chen Guangzhong, who is recognized as the "founder of criminal procedure law" in China. Four years later, he became the first doctoral student in criminal procedural law independently trained by the People's Republic of China, and embarked on a career development path similar to that of his mentor. To date, Bian Jianlin has trained 87 doctors and 11 postdoctoral fellows. He also serves as the honorary dean of the Procedural Law Institute of China University of Political Science and Law, the executive director and academic committee member of the China Law Society, and the honorary president of the China Criminal Procedural Law Research Association. He works as a professor at Jilin University, Wuhan University, Zhongnan University of Economics and Law, East China University of Political Science and Law, Northwest University of Political Science and Law, People's Public Security University of China, and National Prosecutor's College. On social media, he always actively participates in various seminars and academic lectures to share his understanding and suggestions on the construction of the criminal procedure system.

;

;Unwilling to flaunt himself, Bian Jianlin almost never talks about his past experiences in public. Even in this two-hour interview, the topic never got around to his mentor. And he himself seemed to be just an ordinary student who was "older and started school late", and he was lucky enough to get to where he is now by accident.

;

;;Accidentally became the "first";

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the preface of the anthology, it seems that this is the first time you mentioned your experiences as a student. ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I don’t like to talk about my resume. This collection of essays has a profound impact on my academic work. It means life summary, so I said a few words in the preface. I was admitted early at the University of Political Science and Law, and was in the first class after the school was re-established. However, compared with other scholars who entered earlier, I was still relatively older when I entered. Fortunately, I completed my bachelor's degree, master's degree and Ph.D. in one go, so I gained some time back. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; What were you doing before you were admitted to the Beijing University of Political Science and Law in 1979? How did you think of studying law? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;After graduating from high school in 1971, I went to work in a provincial factory. Later, the college entrance examination was resumed, but after all, it was not a required option. Very few of my high school classmates went on to college. At that time, everyone had a job and even got married and had children. But I still have a little bit of ambition, and I have such an ambition to take the exam. As for studying law, it is almost an inevitable choice. First of all, during the ten years of turmoil, our generation was wasted. Basically, we did not learn mathematics, physics and chemistry, and we were seriously partial to subjects. It was not easy to take the science and engineering exams, so we had to choose from liberal arts. Foreign languages, Chinese, history and law, among which law is definitely the most attractive. The main reason is that many of the books I read in the past were about solving crimes, about identifying doubts and clearing grievances, punishing evil and eradicating evil, and upholding justice, so I naturally developed a legal feeling. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Why study Criminal Procedure Law? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;When I was an undergraduate, the school had only one law major, and there was no further subdivision. major. When I was about to graduate, I decided to take the postgraduate entrance examination. According to my personality and interests, I didn’t really like civil law. What I liked most was the “study of criminal justice”, so my major choice should be criminal law. However, there is a certain degree of chance in choosing criminal procedure law. The school's master's entrance exams for Criminal Procedure Law and Criminal Law only differed in one subject, Criminal Procedure Archeology Chinese, while Criminal Law was the history of the legal system. In the year of the postgraduate entrance examination, I went home to celebrate the Spring Festival. After the Spring Festival, I had to take the exam. I thought that I would have to work hard to prepare for the legal history course, and there is always some basic knowledge in ancient Chinese, so it was just a matter of thought. The choice of exam subjects suddenly determined the direction of my major, so it was not that I realized the procedure from that time on. value and importance, because in fact substantive law was still ranked ahead of procedural law at that time. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Law is a practical subject. During your studies, didn’t you ever think about getting into practice? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;To learn the law, you must use it. Logically speaking, you have to work in the practical department , plus I was relatively old when I entered school. At that time, a bachelor's degree was enough, and I also studied for a master's degree. So I faced two choices at the time. One was to follow my family's wishes and return to Jiangsu. The Provincial High School wanted to recruit a Mature judges are more interested in me; if they stay in Beijing, they want to go to the Interpol China National Central Bureau through an old leader of the Ministry of Public Security. I did have some thoughts, but in the end both options were given up, and they were not implemented to the extent of signing a contract. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Why gave up? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;In 1986, before I graduated with my master’s degree, the school was approved for two doctoral programs, including Two teachers were identified as doctoral supervisors, namely Professor Wang Xuan and Professor Chen Guangzhong. Teacher Chen is responsible for the litigation law major. They are also the first batch of doctoral supervisors at China University of Political Science and Law. After receiving the PhD approval, Teacher Chen once talked to me. First, he told me that I had the opportunity to continue my studies; second, he expressed his affirmation to me. After Teacher Chen chatted with me, I was more tempted, although I didn’t fully appreciate the school’s advantages at the time. The most important thing is that my nature is that I am always uneasy about the status quo and have an upward spirit. I have never thought of being rich and settling down. In this way, I decided to continue studying for a Ph.D. after graduating with a master’s degree. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; You obtained your master's degree in 1986 and your doctoral program was approved in the same year. How come it was only a year later that you started studying for your Ph.D.? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I started preparing for the Ph.D. exam before and after I graduated with my master’s degree. However, although the doctoral program was approved at that time, there were insufficient preparations for public announcements and enrollment listings. Due to various reasons, neither doctoral program enrolled students that year. However, Teacher Chen happened to be the deputy dean of the Graduate School at the time, and the school established a new research institution, the Chinese Legal Research Institute, with Teacher Chen also serving as the director. So I stayed in school and worked at the China Legal Research Institute, doing full-time research, doing projects, and writing articles. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; How many doctoral students studied with you under Professor Chen? Why were you the first doctoral student to graduate? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Frankly speaking, in the first year of enrollment, the instructor has candidates in mind , but you still have to follow the formal process when applying. At that time, unlike now, the papers were basically judged on the spot after the exam, and the results were known quickly. Finally, Teacher Chen recruited me, and also recruited someone from our school. He was a master's student in criminal law in 1984, just one class after me. ;

;

;Speaking of this, it is also a coincidence. If the school had recruited doctors in 1986, he had not graduated with a master's degree at that time, and we would not be classmates. . However, although we are both in the first batch of doctoral students, he is a full-time student, while I am a part-time PhD student because I have already stayed in school to work. According to the country's degree regulations at that time, those studying for a PhD on the job would have to study longer than those studying full-time. As for how long, there is no clear regulation. So I extended my studies by one year and graduated in 4 years. If calculated according to this time, it is possible that he graduated before me, then I will not become the first doctorate in criminal procedural law.

;

;But the students in the same class later went to study in the United States and never came back, leaving me alone to hold on. Later, I joked that if he didn't leave, he would definitely graduate before me, and the title of the first doctor of litigation law would belong to him.

;

;;"Follow the teacher's steps";

;

;;Southern Weekends:;;The first batch of 18 Ph.D.s was produced in 1983, but the first recipient of a doctorate in law was graduated in 1987. Among all disciplines, law is not a niche, and it is not too early to cultivate a doctorate in law. What do you think?;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I think the reason for getting a doctorate in law is a little later. First, the doctoral program was of high value at that time. At that time, the approval of the doctoral program and the determination of the doctoral supervisor required the approval of the Academic Degrees Committee of the State Council, which was very strictly controlled. The second reason is that from the perspective of faculty and research level, law was still a discipline with relatively scarce talents and did not have the conditions to train doctoral students. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; In 1988, Professor Chen Guangzhong edited the book "Comparative Research on Foreign Criminal Proceedings". Three years later, your doctoral thesis "Comparative Research on Criminal Prosecution Systems" was approved. From a professional research perspective, did Professor Chen have a great influence on you? big? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Teacher Chen has always attached great importance to understanding and learning from foreign litigation systems. When we were still studying for master's degrees, there was a very lack of teaching materials. Basically, each school compiled and printed its own teaching materials. It happened that when Mr. Chen was the deputy dean of graduate students, he brought a topic from the Institute of Law of the Academy of Social Sciences on foreign criminal litigation. A comparative study of procedures. At that time, reform and opening up had already begun, and we were encouraged to study China's issues from a global perspective. Based on a group of experts from the Law Institute, Teacher Chen recruited some scholars from our school and other schools who studied this field to work together on this work. . Several of our classmates who are still studying for master's degrees also participated in part of it. I participated in writing a chapter, that is, compulsory medical measures, but I did not sign my name separately. I completed it under the guidance of my supervisor. ;

;

;At that time, this book was the first domestic comparative and systematic study of foreign criminal procedure. It was both authoritative and precious. If you want to know more about it, If you know something about it abroad, you must read this book. For those of us who participated in writing this book, because writing required research on foreign materials, only the University of Political Science and Law had this condition at the time, so it was the first step for me to broaden my academic horizons.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the previous In an article, you called Professor Chen "the leading figure in criminal procedure law in New China." Do you have any observations about his academic studies and his conduct as a person? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Teacher Chen is a recognized master and an important founder and leader of our discipline. people. I feel that my husband's biggest specialty in learning is to learn from the best of other schools, to be open to all rivers, and to be tolerant, so later on he suddenly surpassed other teachers of his generation and was beyond the reach of others; the second is to know people and make good use of them, and make full use of their talents. Every time he writes something or works on a project, he can always hand over the relevant content to the most suitable person; the third thing is to be able to pay attention to and accept new things, and constantly improve himself by guiding students. ;

;

;In addition to learning, the teacher also has a strong sense of responsibility and mission. He cares about current affairs and is now 93 years old. He is still paying attention to social phenomena and judicial practice.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Professor Chen’s Do personal traits influence you? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Mr. Chen has had a great influence on me. Over the years, I can say that I have been closely related to him. He followed suit every step of the way. In addition to the master-disciple relationship, my position also determines why my behavior, knowledge and knowledge are closer to those of my husband. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; You and Professor Chen have been promoting the localization and application of some overseas experiences. In this process, what impact has reform and opening up had? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Mr. Chen is an iconic figure in the field of criminal procedure law in my country. The development and improvement of the criminal procedure system can be said to have made a great contribution and deserved the most credit. In terms of participation in legislation, when the Criminal Procedure Law was formulated in 1979, there were relatively few scholars involved. Mr. Chen was still in Guangxi at that time. I feel that this was his regret. The revision of the Criminal Procedure Law in 1996 was an opportunity to make amends, and Mr. Chen played a great role in the revision of the law. ;

;

;I still remember that in the winter of 1992, after Mr. Chen became the president of China University of Political Science and Law, his first symposium was held at the school. In the now demolished international student building, the director of the Criminal Law Office of the Legal Affairs Committee of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress came with the director. At that time, the law was being revised. In 1993, because I assisted Mr. Chen in promoting the first revision of the Criminal Procedure Law, I was sent to study at New York University as a core member of the research team. Later, I participated in an inspection delegation led by Mr. Chen to several European countries. The director of the Criminal Law Office of the Legal Affairs Commission also participated in the inspection. After returning to China, the Legal Affairs Committee formally sent a letter to the school, entrusting Mr. Chen to lead a research team to provide opinions on the revision of the law. A year later, Mr. Chen’s research team submitted a 350,000-word “Recommendation Draft for the Criminal Procedure Law of the People’s Republic of China” to the Legal Affairs Commission, of which 65% of the provisions were absorbed.

;

;In addition to domestic projects, I assisted Mr. Chen in conducting some international exchanges and cooperation and conducting some comparative law research. For example, it selects students to study abroad, translates and publishes the criminal procedure codes of some representative countries, promotes the implementation of international human rights conventions and United Nations criminal justice guidelines in China, etc. It should be said that it has done a lot of useful things to promote the development and improvement of my country's criminal procedure system, and also promoted the discipline construction and talent cultivation of procedural law at China University of Political Science and Law. These were unique to the University of Political Science and Law at that time. Other schools neither had this team strength nor the necessary conditions and capabilities.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Amending the Constitution in 2004 At that time, Professor Chen proposed that "the state respects and protects human rights" be written into the Constitution; in 2012, when the Criminal Procedure Law was revised for the second time, this article was written into the Criminal Procedure Law. As his student, you have always advocated that criminal procedure law should protect individual rights. Why have you been so concerned about this issue? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Human rights protection is very closely related to criminal proceedings. Criminal procedure law is a typical field where public power operates and an important tool for national governance. For a long time, influenced by concepts, systems and even ideologies, we have regarded criminal proceedings as a contest between the state and crime, emphasizing the punishment of crimes, resulting in the lack of effective restrictions on the power of specialized state agencies in litigation activities. Correspondingly, the rights and interests of criminal suspects, defendants and other litigation participants cannot be fully protected. From the perspective of social development trends, the country's comprehensive promotion of governing the country according to law and building a country ruled by law means regulating public power through the rule of law and procedures to prevent power from being alienated and abused. Mr. Chen has a full understanding of this and has done a lot of work , through their own efforts to strengthen human rights protection in the judiciary, influence legislation, and improve the judiciary. Under the leadership of Mr. Chen, we have also made our own efforts and contributions to this end. ;

;

;;"It is not enough to do it yourself";

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In a previous school lecture, you and the students discussed the vindication of unjust, false and wrongful convictions. Judging from past news reports, lawyers representing many cases are known as "hard-nosed lawyers". What do you think of this group? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;The defense system and the lawyer profession reflect the level of the rule of law in a country. If the level of lawyers in a country is very weak and the defense system is not perfect, it is impossible to progress in criminal litigation. When the Criminal Procedure Law was formulated in 1979, there were basically no lawyers. Interim Regulations on Lawyers were only introduced in 1980. Therefore, the legislative provisions on lawyer defense are relatively backward. However, several revisions to the Criminal Procedure Law since 1996 have improved the lawyer defense system. Overall, the progress of the defense system is obvious to all. ;

;

;But at the same time, it should be noted that there are still many problems in the legal provisions regarding lawyer defense, especially in judicial practice. I think one of the important reasons is that we have not found an accurate positioning of the lawyer profession and lawyer defense. In criminal proceedings, the defense lawyer's duty is to defend the defendant, find faults and discover problems from various angles such as facts, evidence, legal application, procedural operation, etc., so as to promote the fair handling of the case and thereby improve the level of the rule of law. By nature, lawyers do not exercise public power and are not members of the case-handling agency. Our management of lawyers is different. Lawyers are managed by judicial administrative agencies, which are part of the specialized state agencies.

;

;In judicial practice, in order to provide effective defense, to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the parties, or to ensure that legal procedures are complied with, lawyers need to be more truthful when performing their defense duties. Sometimes there are conflicts with the case-handling agencies, so some lawyers are called "die-hard lawyers." But if they are not serious and fight to the death, they will not be able to protect the interests of the parties involved, and they will not be able to carry out defense work normally. Recently, some extreme examples have occurred, such as a court in Laibin, Guangxi, which forced lawyers to undergo security checks, made things difficult for them, and violated their legitimate rights and interests. This had a very bad impact, which attracted the attention of people across the country and was named by the Supreme Court. I think after such an extreme thing happens, the entire court system should take a warning.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Seems like this contradiction This occurs in many of our legal systems. ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin: ;;It is not enough to do it yourself. It does take time for the law on paper to become law in action, and various problems will arise during the implementation process. In a certain sense, many of the problems or difficulties faced in my country's current judicial practice are caused by the development of the system. Some things that seem good are actually very difficult to do. It may touch the interests of some people and even intensify conflicts. I believe that problems in development must still be solved by development. On the one hand, we must know more about the situation and pay attention to practice when designing the system; on the other hand, once the law is revised, the authority of the law must be maintained, and the case-handling agencies must strictly enforce the law. Take the lead in abiding by the law and earnestly abide by the procedures prescribed by law. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; In the past, everyone said that law is a humanities and social science, but now it is said that law is an engineering discipline within the humanities and social sciences. What do you think of this view? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;There is no doubt that law is a humanities and social science, at least a discipline, or It is science, and it does have some attributes of engineering. Especially our discipline is very applicable and operable. When we studied in the past, we studied "Criminal Procedure Law", but now it is called "Criminal Procedure Law". The addition of the word "study" actually means that we realize that this is a science and a knowledge system. It is not just about interpreting the meaning of the law, but also using it to govern society and achieve good results. Taking the ascertainment of case facts as an example, it is not only an epistemological issue, but also involves axiology and methodology. Due procedures must be used to regulate the exercise of power by the case-handling agencies. Generally speaking, procedural law is an operational norm. It must have a specific set of principles, rules, methods, procedures and institutional norms, and it must be meticulous and operable, so that litigation activities can be followed by law. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; With more than 40 years of study and academic experience, do you have any experience that you can share with young students? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Whether I am a scholar or a teacher, I actually learned from Mr. Chen , he set an example for us, teaching us to be patriotic and caring for the people, to have an open vision, and to have a spirit of research. This is what I strive to follow when doing academic work. In addition, I often remind students to care about current affairs and pay attention to the present. Many things happen around us every day, or there are examples closely related to our profession every day. Don't turn a deaf ear or be indifferent. ;

;

;As for how to learn and how to write articles, this is indeed not an easy task. I think that first of all, individuals need to work hard, and at the same time, they also need opportunities. When we were studying, we should say that there were more opportunities. There was a shortage of people in front of us because of the passing of generations, and the society was in urgent need of talents, so that we would be the first in this and the first in that way. Nowadays, law has become a prominent school. Young people are under great pressure, but there are not many opportunities. Then they need to be more diligent, redouble their efforts, be calm, endure loneliness, and never let go of their youth. If they really learn, they will achieve something. There are times when you can use force and give appropriate rewards.

;

;

;A black box stood on the stage. "Endgame" had not officially started, but the two characters were already inside. Extremely similar clips are repeated over and over again, as if the stage has turned into a machine that plays on a loop due to malfunction. The servant Clover wrung his fingers and walked the same route repeatedly with a strange gait. He stepped back from the door to the right of Master Ham's wheelchair, walked to the corner on the left, and then to the door on the right, taking fourteen precise steps, every time.

;

;The dialogue has not changed either. "Do you want me to leave you?" "Of course." "Then I will leave you." "You can't leave me." "Then I won't leave you." The door was opened and closed again and again.

;

;In 1953, "Waiting for Godot" brought Beckett worldwide fame, but his favorite work was "Endgame" written four years later.

;

;;

;

;Beckett's play "Endgame" will be performed at the 10th Wuzhen International Theater Festival in 2023. ;(Photo courtesy of the organizer);

;

;This play shows four deformed people in an empty house that is approaching the end of the world. : The master Ham is paralyzed from the lower body, blind, and has been sitting in a wheelchair; the servant Clover has a disease in his knees and cannot sit down. Ham's parents, Nag and Nell, have lost their lower limbs and live in two trash cans. The relationships between masters and servants, husbands and wives, and parents and children all show an extremely cruel side, but they are interdependent and inseparable.

;

;In the impression of Tobias Bianconi, Director General of the International Theater Association, in the past, the audience's reaction to Beckett and even absurdist plays was sometimes "very frustrating and unhappy", but After he walked out of the theater, he found that after watching this version of the Vienna Volkstheater's performance, the Chinese audience was full of energy and had lively discussions. They all felt that the play was very fresh. "Why is there such a reaction? What is the background that makes the audience like this play so much?" he was curious.

;

;In the 20th century, which experienced the ravages of two world wars and was immersed in industrialization and the post-industrial era, the rationalism admired by Western civilization fell into crisis, belief in God collapsed, and self-doubt and self-denial became the themes of the times. This also brought profound conceptual changes to drama. What Beckett's drama expresses is the antagonistic relationship between human beings and nature, society, self and others who are completely alienated in social crisis.

;

;Absurd drama, which was born in Paris, France, in the early 1950s, was echoed again in Wuzhen, China, seventy years later. "At the beginning, we thought the most exciting thing was this very unhealthy and toxic relationship between characters. Later we found that it had some parts related to war. As it slowly developed, we found that it might be related to climate change. Recently, We found that it was combined with the COVID-19 epidemic." During the dialogue, theater director and German director Kai Vogels said that this version of "Endgame" has been performed for eleven years. "The point of it being constantly performed is that it is always new. , what we see from this drama keeps changing."

;

;;

;

;Beckett's play "Endgame" was written in the late 1950s. The version that came to China has already been sold in Europe Acted for eleven years. ;(Photo courtesy of the organizer);

;

;Vogels refined the four characters into two clown-like people, retaining the main theme A very tense contrast between servants: Ham is physically disabled, but has the power to control Clover; Clough is relatively able to move freely, but is always dominated by his master to do unnecessary trivial things, and his spirit tends to be paralyzed. .

;

;The most eye-catching adaptation is Vogels’ emphasis on the sense of looping. The line, which was on an infinite loop before the show even started, only appeared once in the original script. Vogels uses this as the opening or closing line of every dialogue, repeating it a dozen times throughout the play.

;

;A new plot in the play brings an "anti-climax": after Clover struggled, he shot Hamm, but the expected relief brought by death did not happen. After the monologue, Ham suddenly answered and got up from the ground, as if nothing had happened. Clover and he returned to their usual endless conversation.

;

;"Beckett actually demonstrated a ritual cycle on the stage. The ending of this ritual cycle is satisfaction, nothingness, or the end of the world. Everyone can see it differently. Each point has its own interpretation, and what I present on the stage also has this meaning." At the beginning of the rehearsal, Voges hoped to show the inextricable cycle of repetition on the stage without making the audience feel bored. This balance Feeling is what he is looking for.

;

;Since 1998 Vogels has been a theater and opera director in Austria and Germany. German drama is relatively lagging behind in digital innovation. From 2010 to 2020, while serving as the artistic director of the Dortmund Theater in Germany, Vogels began to try to combine digital media with drama and introduce digital thinking to the drama stage. He is a pioneer.

;

;Among these works, digital techniques such as VR, real-time imaging, and on-site editing are emerging in endlessly. "Endgame" pursues Beckett's minimalist style. However, the artificially isolated cramped space, heavy metal-style amplified sound effects, The sudden switching of dazzling lights, the characters' mechanically looping movements and lines, all give this picture of the human spiritual wasteland a cold science fiction color.

;

;The more traditional images such as "desert" and "dead branches" in Beckett's original work are missing. In terms of stage design, the play chose a form that abstracted away from reality. Like the door, the few sets and props are all outlined with white chalk lines. Three-dimensional life seems to be locked in two-dimensional space. Machine guns and toy dogs are just thin wooden boards hanging on the wall when they are not picked out by actors and held in their hands. The clock has no hands and the flowers in the vase are out of proportion. The only real objects are the wooden chair with armrests in the center of the stage and the light bulb hanging in the air.

;

;The actors' performances are consistent with German precision, and they achieve the ultimate in repetitive movements with slight changes. The actor who played Ham sat in a chair with his eyes closed throughout the performance, but still showed a strong sense of dominance and oppression in the relationship through his tone and gestures.

;

;The voice can be called the third "starring" of this drama, expanding the information and emotional density in the minimalist world. Clough's footsteps continued to echo in the space, powerful, but as flat as the scenery, with no specific sense of direction. Footsteps create a strong conflict with directionlessness. Every time Clover dropped something he was holding, there was a loud cracking sound, whether it was a telescope, a machine gun, or a toy dog. The laws of the physical world break down here.

;

;The two people, who are both master and servant and father and son, are imprisoned in a lifeless atmosphere. The room they were in was, in a sense, like the final game board in a chess match. Ham is the general on the chessboard and needs to ensure that he is in the "center" of the room, controlling his pieces. The little soldier Clover could barely move a few steps, but under the command of blind Ham, the situation was certain to lose, but they could not and did not dare to leave the room, just like the chess pieces could not leave the chessboard. "There is no nature anymore" outside the house. Even when I opened the window, I saw "ZERO" written on the blackboard.

;

;They passed the time by teasing, controlling, and torturing each other, telling the old stories again, and looking at the window that they had looked at countless times, hoping that something would happen. What happened in front of my eyes was that other people passed by the window. However, their expectations were all in vain, and all their actions no longer made much sense.

;

;At the end of the play, I realized that the beginning was the end. "What time is it?" "Same as usual." They repeated the dialogue at the opening. Everything stopped suddenly, leaving silence and darkness.

;"Miracle doctors" sell a bunch of titles to their patients. Nongjian Illustration

;

;Qingdao’s “veteran Chinese medicine doctor” Hou Yuanxiang, who pretended to be an expert and professor and practiced medicine illegally for more than ten years, fell for his homemade “anti-cancer drug” - in February 2023, Hou Yuanxiang was arrested by Qingdao in the first instance The Huangdao District People's Court of the city sentenced him to 12 years in prison and fined him 12 million yuan for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs."

;

;Like Hou Yuanxiang, his daughter, son, wife and former son-in-law were also sentenced for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" and were sentenced to prison terms ranging from 11 to 3 years respectively. In addition, the son of Hou Yuanxiang's third sister was also involved in the case. He was sentenced to 11 years in prison for "fraud" and "harboring" in the first instance.

;

;The total prison term for the above six people is 50 years, and the total fine is 29.8 million yuan. Southern Weekend reporters searched online for judgment documents and found that among counterfeit drug cases in recent years, the first-instance verdict in Hou Yuanxiang's case was extremely rare in terms of heavy sentencing and high fines.

;

;However, the case has not yet been settled. After the first-instance verdict, as Hou Yuanxiang and others filed an appeal, many self-media appeared on the Internet to "cry out injustice" for them. Some associated the case with the "folk traditional Chinese medicine" group, believing that "if this lawsuit is lost, almost all folk Chinese medicine practitioners must close their doors." (For details, please see the report ;"The Online Public Opinion War on the "Miracle Cancer Doctor";)

;

; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 08:25:03 +0800 同性性行为进化的逻辑http://www.infzm.com/contents/260881
